##  INVESTOR RELATIONS 

###  The Fintech as a Service Platform at the Center of Indonesia’s Digital Financial Revolution Digiasia’s embedded fintech solutions fuel the growth of Indonesia’s commerce ecosystem from Enteprise to Merchants to Consumers: B2B2X

FAAS 

$0.58

#### Current Stock Price

▼ $-0.06

#### Change

Nov 29, 2024 4:03 PM ET

![](https://investors.digiasia.asia/wp-content/uploads/sites/1371/2024/06/Copy-of-Copy-of-DigiBos.png)

## About Us

DigiAsia was founded in November 2017 with a vision of building the most complete and embedded Fintech platform for emerging markets in Southeast Asia to drive digital financial inclusion and hence enterprise business growth.

DigiAsia is Indonesia’s leading “Fintech as a Service” (FaaS) ecosystem provider, enabling enterprises to grow business with their distribution partners and customers by digitalizing and streamlining their commerce processes across the value chain.

DigiAsia offers a full set of digital finance solutions including closed and open loop wallets, QR payments, cash based and digital remittances, accessible digital financial services served in rural areas by appointed micro and small enterpreneurs, card issuance and smart lending through a set of open access APIs, which are embedded in the clients’ processes and offerings. Importantly, DigiAsia owns all critical Fintech and Banking licenses to deploy and manage those finance solutions for its clients. DigiAsia also actively manages and grows a vast network of small merchants, Indonesia’s most important sales channel by far, to drive digital commerce acceptance and reach for its enterprise clients.

Today, DigiAsia’s FaaS platform and ecosystem connects more than 200 of Indonesia’s leading enterprises with a network of over 1 million active merchants to accelerate B2B and B2C e-payment adoption, product and payment flow, working capital efficiency and fraud management. DigiAsia’s fintech solutions serve major industry players such as Starbucks, Unilever, Garuda and KAI (Indonesia National Railway). Southeast Asian government entities rely on DigiAsia to handle cross border transactions, and leading financial institutions such as DBS and Citibank serve as lenders that permit DigiAsia to bank the ecosystem.
